reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: The Finnish government emphasises effectiveness impact and measurement of results in its development policy. Agenda203 and the SDGs provide an overall framework for development policy and cooperation and a basis for evaluation. Agenda 2030 requires stronge r coherence between policy fields and cooperation between the evaluation functions of different ministries. Capacity development is a means to promote this cooperation. Development evaluation is a fundamental element of the ministry?s results-based managem ent system. High quality evaluations and utilization of their results require capacity from staff and the ministry and embassies as institutions. EVA-11 work programme includes several activities that aim at evaluation capacity development and enhanced use of evaluation results throuhgout the foreign affairs: identification of evaluation capacity development needs design and implementation of training programmes updating of guidelines help desk services on evaluation development of evaluation practices and communications. Capacity development may also be done through participation in international initiatives or processes. The activities funded within the intervention cover evaluation capacity development of ministry and embassy staff basic and further train ing of EVA-11 staff study- and networking missions training of evaluators and support services for capacity development advisory services and communications.
